page.title: 13 OSWALD OF AUCHINCRUIVE
page.content: The stately mansion of{Auchincruive {House}was built in the latter half of the eighteenth century as the home of {Richard Oswald.} In 1760 the lands of{Auchincruive were acquired by Oswald, who was a rich merchant in London. Originally, this man, born in Thurso,wanted to be a schoolmaster.However,he did not obtain the post and left his homeland to seek his fortune in London.He did become very successful by supplying goods to the army and bought the lands of{Auchincruive in 1763. His brother the Rev.James Oswald was left to look after the estate. When James died in 1819, George,his son,succeeded him. { Richard,}son of Richard Oswald,was {Member of Parliament}for Ayrshire in the years{1833 to 1835.
